aggregates.max: Max - The maximum value recorded during a time interval. A higher maximum value could have occurred without it being recorded.
aggregates.average: Avg - The average of values recorded during a time interval.
aggregates.total: Total - Sum of the values recorded for each node during a time interval.
aggregates.min: Min - The minimal value recorded during a time interval. A lower minimal value could have occurred without it being recorded.

cross-node-latency.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of the latency of messages between nodes. The time period starts when a node sends a message and ends when the current node receives it.
cross-node-latency.label: Node Messaging Latency
cross-node-latency.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
cross-node-latency.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
cross-node-latency.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
cross-node-latency.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
cross-node-latency.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

cross-dc-latency.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of the message latency between nodes in the same or different destination datacenter. This metric measures how long it takes a message from a node in the source datacenter to reach a node in the destination datacenter. Selecting a destination node within the source datacenter yields lower latency values.
cross-dc-latency.label: Datacenter Messaging Latency
cross-dc-latency.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
cross-dc-latency.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
cross-dc-latency.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
cross-dc-latency.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
cross-dc-latency.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

solr-query-metrics-execute.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a execute. Comprises the time spent by a single shard to execute the actual index query. This value is computed on the local node executing the shard query.
solr-query-metrics-execute.label: Search: Query Metrics Execute
solr-query-metrics-execute.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
solr-query-metrics-execute.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
solr-query-metrics-execute.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
solr-query-metrics-execute.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
solr-query-metrics-execute.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

solr-query-metrics-coordinate.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a coordinate. Comprises the total amount of time spent by the coordinator node to distribute the query and gather/process results from shards. This value is computed only on query coordinator nodes. Includes RETRIEVE and EXECUTE in the total.
solr-query-metrics-coordinate.label: Search: Query Metrics Coordinate
solr-query-metrics-coordinate.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
solr-query-metrics-coordinate.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
solr-query-metrics-coordinate.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
solr-query-metrics-coordinate.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
solr-query-metrics-coordinate.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

solr-query-metrics-retrieve.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a retrieve. Comprises the time spent by a node to retrieve a single row from the database. This value will be computed on the local node hosting the requested data.
solr-query-metrics-retrieve.label: Search: Query Metrics Retrieve
solr-query-metrics-retrieve.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
solr-query-metrics-retrieve.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
solr-query-metrics-retrieve.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
solr-query-metrics-retrieve.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
solr-query-metrics-retrieve.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

solr-merge-metrics-warm.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a warm. How long it takes to warm up segments to speed up cold queries.
solr-merge-metrics-warm.label: Search: Merge Metrics Warm
solr-merge-metrics-warm.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
solr-merge-metrics-warm.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
solr-merge-metrics-warm.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
solr-merge-metrics-warm.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
solr-merge-metrics-warm.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

solr-merge-metrics-init.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a init. How long it takes to initialize the merge process.
solr-merge-metrics-init.label: Search: Merge Metrics Init
solr-merge-metrics-init.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
solr-merge-metrics-init.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
solr-merge-metrics-init.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
solr-merge-metrics-init.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
solr-merge-metrics-init.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

solr-merge-metrics-execute.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a execute. How long it takes to execute the merge process.
solr-merge-metrics-execute.label: Search: Merge Metrics Execute
solr-merge-metrics-execute.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
solr-merge-metrics-execute.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
solr-merge-metrics-execute.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
solr-merge-metrics-execute.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
solr-merge-metrics-execute.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

solr-update-metrics-execute.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a execute. The time spent to actually execute the index update on Apache Lucene.
solr-update-metrics-execute.label: Search: Update Metrics Execute
solr-update-metrics-execute.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
solr-update-metrics-execute.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
solr-update-metrics-execute.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
solr-update-metrics-execute.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
solr-update-metrics-execute.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

solr-update-metrics-prepare.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a prepare. The time spent preparing the actual index update.
solr-update-metrics-prepare.label: Search: Update Metrics Prepare
solr-update-metrics-prepare.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
solr-update-metrics-prepare.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
solr-update-metrics-prepare.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
solr-update-metrics-prepare.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
solr-update-metrics-prepare.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

solr-update-metrics-queue.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a queue. Updated for reindexing only. The time spent by the index update task into the index pool.
solr-update-metrics-queue.label: Search: Update Metrics Queue
solr-update-metrics-queue.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
solr-update-metrics-queue.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
solr-update-metrics-queue.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
solr-update-metrics-queue.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
solr-update-metrics-queue.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

solr-update-metrics-write.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a queue. Updated for reindexing only.
solr-update-metrics-write.label: Search: Update Metrics Write
solr-update-metrics-write.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
solr-update-metrics-write.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
solr-update-metrics-write.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
solr-update-metrics-write.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
solr-update-metrics-write.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

solr-commit-metrics-flush.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a flush. Comprising the time spent by flushing the async indexing queue.
solr-commit-metrics-flush.label: Search: Commit Metrics Flush
solr-commit-metrics-flush.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
solr-commit-metrics-flush.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
solr-commit-metrics-flush.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
solr-commit-metrics-flush.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
solr-commit-metrics-flush.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

solr-commit-metrics-execute.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a execute. Comprising the time spent by actually executing the commit on the index.
solr-commit-metrics-execute.label: Search: Commit Metrics Execute
solr-commit-metrics-execute.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
solr-commit-metrics-execute.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
solr-commit-metrics-execute.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
solr-commit-metrics-execute.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
solr-commit-metrics-execute.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

solr-index-pool-back-pressure-pause-nano.description: Get the average back pressure pause.
solr-index-pool-back-pressure-pause-nano.label: Search: IndexPool - Back Pressure Pause Nanos

solr-index-pool-incoming-rate.description: Get the 1-minute rate of ingested tasks per second.
solr-index-pool-incoming-rate.label: Search: IndexPool - Incoming Rate

solr-index-pool-outgoing-rate.description: Get the 1-minute rate of processed tasks per second.
solr-index-pool-outgoing-rate.label: Search: IndexPool - Outgoing Rate

solr-index-pool-queue-size1.description: Get the current size of each processing queues.
solr-index-pool-queue-size1.label: Search: IndexPool - Queue Size

solr-index-pool-task-processing-time-nan.description: Get the last processing time for all workers. Could be 0 in case the clock resolution is too coarse.
solr-index-pool-task-processing-time-nan.label: Search: IndexPool - Task Processing Time Nanos

solr-stall-metrics-flush.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a flush.
solr-stall-metrics-flush.label: Search: Stall Metrics Flush
solr-stall-metrics-flush.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
solr-stall-metrics-flush.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
solr-stall-metrics-flush.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
solr-stall-metrics-flush.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
solr-stall-metrics-flush.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

solr-stall-metrics-merge.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a merge.

solr-stall-metrics-merge.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
solr-stall-metrics-merge.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
solr-stall-metrics-merge.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.
solr-stall-metrics-merge.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
solr-stall-metrics-merge.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.

solr-filter-cache-metrics-hits.description: Cache hits for the registered index searcher.
solr-filter-cache-metrics-hits.label: Search: Filter Cache Metrics - Hits

solr-filter-cache-metrics-lookups.description: Number of cache lookups. Cache lookups for the registered index searcher.
solr-filter-cache-metrics-lookups.label: Search: Filter Cache Metrics - Lookups

solr-filter-cache-metrics-inserts.description: Number of entries inserted to the cache. Cache insertions for the registered index searcher.
solr-filter-cache-metrics-inserts.label: Search: Filter Cache Metrics - Inserts

solr-filter-cache-metrics-last-eviction-.description: Time in milliseconds used by the most recent eviction.
solr-filter-cache-metrics-last-eviction-.label: Search: Filter Cache Metrics - Last Eviction Time in millies

solr-filter-cache-metrics-used-bytes.description: Size of the filter cache in bytes.
solr-filter-cache-metrics-used-bytes.label: Search: Filter Cache Metrics - Used Bytes

solr-filter-cache-metrics-evictions.description: Number of entries evicted from the cache. Cache evictions for the registered index searcher.
solr-filter-cache-metrics-evictions.label: Search: Filter Cache Metrics - Evictions
